page.title: 03Oakham Church
page.content: The present Oakham Parish Church was built in the 14th Century although there has been a Church here since Norman times. The present church was restored in the 19th century. It is one of the best church buildings in the county. There are four items of interest kept in the church. Two are beautiful Elizabethan chalices, another is the Oakham Bible which was written on parchment a couple of years before Magna Carta. The fourth thing is an alabaster figure of a girl called Anne Burton who died at the beginning of the Civil War. (by Alexander Foreman)
